title: Fuhrman Nuclear Grade for Clear Cell Renal Carcinoma
description: Provides prognostic grading system for clear cell renal cell carcinoma (RCC) based on nuclear morphology and cellular appearance. Independent predictor of cancer-specific survival that correlates nuclear grade with prognosis.

parameters.name: nuclear_diameter
parameters.description: Size of tumor cell nuclei compared to lymphocytes

parameters.name: nuclear_shape
parameters.description: Shape and regularity of nuclear outline

parameters.name: bizarre_multilobed_spindle
parameters.description: Presence of bizarre, multilobed nuclei or spindle cells

ranges.interpretation: Small nuclei (<10 µm), hyperchromatic, round (resembling mature lymphocytes), with no visible nucleoli and little detail in the chromatin. Best prognosis among all grades.

ranges.description: Slightly irregular nuclei with visible nucleoli
ranges.interpretation: Larger nuclei (15 µm), may be oval with finely granular chromatin. Nucleoli visible at 400x magnification. Intermediate prognosis.

ranges.description: Obviously irregular nuclei with prominent nucleoli
ranges.interpretation: Even larger nuclei (20 µm), coarsely granular chromatin, easily recognizable nucleoli at 100x magnification. Worse prognosis than grades 1-2.
Extreme nuclear pleomorphism, bizarre multilobed nuclei, spindle cells, rhabdoid morphology or sarcomatoid differentiation. Poorest prognosis.

references: Fuhrman SA, Lasky LC, Limas C. Prognostic significance of morphologic parameters in renal cell carcinoma. Am J Surg Pathol. 1982 Oct;6(7):655-63. doi: 10.1097/00000478-198210000-00007.

Rioux-Leclercq N, Karakiewicz PI, Trinh QD, Ficarra V, Cindolo L, de la Taille A, et al. Prognostic ability of simplified nuclear grading of renal cell carcinoma. Cancer. 2007 Mar 1;109(5):868-74. doi: 10.1002/cncr.22463.

Delahunt B, Cheville JC, Martignoni G, Humphrey PA, Magi-Galluzzi C, McKenney J, et al. The International Society of Urological Pathology (ISUP) grading system for renal cell carcinoma and other prognostic parameters. Am J Surg Pathol. 2013 Oct;37(10):1490-504. doi: 10.1097/PAS.0b013e318299f0fb.
formula: Grading based on nuclear diameter, shape, nucleoli visibility, and presence of bizarre features. Grade 1-3 determined by worst feature among the first three parameters. Grade 4 if bizarre/multilobed nuclei or spindle cells present.
notes: Grade is assigned based on the highest grade features present in the tumor
The WHO/ISUP grading system is now recommended over Fuhrman grading for better prognostic accuracy
Nuclear grade is one of the most important prognostic factors in renal cell carcinoma
Most tumors are grades 2-3; grade 1 is rare (<5%), grade 4 accounts for 5-10%
Higher grades correlate with worse cancer-specific survival
